intro: Sageretia rugosa, commonly known as the rough sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Sageretia rugosa is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
